libs/mangle/sound/sources/sample_reader.hpp

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 #ifndef MANGLE_SOUND_SAMPLE_READER_H
00002 #define MANGLE_SOUND_SAMPLE_READER_H
00003 
00004 #include "../source.hpp"
00005 
00006 namespace Mangle {
00007 namespace Sound {
00008 
00009   /* This is a helper base class for other SampleSource
00010      implementations. Certain sources (like Audiere and libsndfile)
00011      insist on reading whole samples rather than bytes. This class
00012      compensates for that, and allows you to read bytes rather than
00013      samples.
00014 
00015      There are two ways for subclasses to use this class. EITHER call
00016      setup() with the size of frameSize. This will allocate a buffer,
00017      which the destructor frees. OR set frameSize manually and
00018      manipulate the pullOver pointer yourself. In that case you MUST
00019      reset it to NULL if you don't want the destructor to call
00020      delete[] on it.
00021    */
00022 class SampleReader : public SampleSource
00023 {
00024   // How much of the above buffer is in use.
00025   int pullSize;
00026 
00027 protected:
00028   // Pullover buffer
00029   char* pullOver;
00030 
00031   // Size of one frame, in bytes. This is also the size of the
00032   // pullOver buffer.
00033   int frameSize;
00034 
00035   // The parameter gives the size of one sample/frame, in bytes.
00036   void setup(int);
00037 
00038   // Read the given number of samples, in multiples of frameSize. Does
00039   // not have to set or respect isEof.
00040   virtual size_t readSamples(void *data, size_t num) = 0;
00041 
00042  public:
00043   SampleReader() : pullSize(0), pullOver(NULL) {}
00044   ~SampleReader();
00045   size_t read(void *data, size_t length);
00046 };
00047 }} // Namespace
00048 #endif
